result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin Alexander Dewindt

records.addlTxt:
OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Devin Alexander Dewindt not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Devin Alexander Dewindt.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea Hearing. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel provides an update to the court regarding the current posture of this case. Court adjourns case for an additional status conference date so the defendant can be present via zoom. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Devin Alexander Dewindt not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Motion Hearing. Defendant not produced. Court addresses defense's motion to sever. No objections from the state. Court orders cases severed. Further, Court vacates 11/07/2022 jury trial date and adjourns case for a Plea Hearing date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. STATE RESPONSE TO DEFENDANTS MOTION TO SEVER
Received and Filed. MOTION FOR MODIFICATION OF BRIEFING SCHEDULE

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Devin Alexander Dewindt not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel requests Motion Hearing and Jury Trial dates from the court. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Court grants request and sets the following deadlines: 07/13/2022 deadline for filing the motion to sever. 07/27/2022 deadline for state's response. 10/24/2022 deadline for filing any trial documents. Case adjourned to Br 16. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Devin Alexander Dewindt in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Devin Alexander Dewindt in custody.  John Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The case was in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held via zoom.  Attorney Peter Kovac in court stating he was contacted by the Defendant's family, however he has not been retained.   The court will allow time for Attorney Kovac to meet with the defendant's family and the defendant.  The matter is adjourned back to Branch 16 via zoom for Status of Counsel. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Devin Alexander Dewindt in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton; both appear by video.  Defendant Devin Alexander Dewindt in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 17CF5812. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Abdulghani. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devin Alexander Dewindt in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Devin Alexander Dewindt in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devin Alexander Dewindt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
